column3: Language name (in native language). This means the NAME OF THE LANGUAGE BEING TRANSLATED INTO, and should NOT be a translation of the word 'English'
Default selection in language selection menu.
Shown when awaiting user input when changing a key setting.

column2: View your city from a different perspective
*Mouse Primary Click: change the key / cancel *Mouse Secondary Click: remove
When exiting FPS Cam, set the camera position back to where it's left beforehand
Scaling factor of Info panel's height
The maximum degree to rotate camera up & down.

For Free-Camera Mode: 
 -[None] free movement 
 -[AboveGround] camera always above ground 
 -[SnapToGround] camera sticks to ground 
 -[AboveRoad] camera always above the closest road 
 -[SnapToRoad] camera sticks to the closest road or ground
Vertical offset for ground level for ground clipping option
Vertical offset for road level for ground clipping option
Camera looks toward the position the target is going to be.
In Follow Mode, camera needs to move instantly with the target even when smooth transition is enabled. \n This sets the minimum distance to start applying smooth transition.
Use secondary mouse click to switch following targets instead.
Auto moving toggle in Free-Camera mode
Camera moves forward automatically when it's toggled on.
Save the current camera setting as default
In Follow/Walk-Through mode, save the current camera setting for the followed target
When camera moves, rotates or zooms, the transition could be either smooth or instant. \nEnabling the option could make camera look lagging.
When the camera target position is too far, smooth transition takes too long.\nThis number sets the distance to give up the transition.

column3: this setting will not displayed in the settings screen,so you can skip it

column2: Field of View scaling factor by scrolling
Adjusting the speed of scroll wheel scaling in the FPS Cam
Cam fixed offset for vehicle in the middle
Max duration for exiting FPS Cam

column3: You can find a reference to this value in FPSCamera/PedestrianCam.cs in the repo.
